dt: {bc}to have personal or direct cognizance of {bc}see for oneself

dt.t: our grammar—{wi}witness{/wi} our verb system—is a marvel of flexibility, variety, and exactitude

dt: {bc}to constitute the scene or time of

dt.t: structures … which this striking Dorset hilltop once {wi}witnessed{/wi}

dt: {bc}to bear witness to one's religious convictions

pt: {sc}certify{/sc} {sc}attest{/sc} {sc}witness{/sc} {sc}vouch{/sc} mean to testify to the truth or genuineness of something. {sc}certify{/sc} usually applies to a written statement, especially one carrying a signature or seal.

pt.t: {it}certified{/it} that the candidate had met all requirements

pt: {sc}attest{/sc} applies to oral or written testimony usually from experts or witnesses.

pt.t: {it}attested{/it} to the authenticity of the document

pt: {sc}witness{/sc} applies to the subscribing of one's own name to a document as evidence of its genuineness.
{sc}vouch{/sc} applies to one who testifies as a competent authority or a reliable person.

shortdef: to act as legal witness of
